body_html:
Maybe we are reading different documentation, because it is claimed that embedding_rnn_decoder does this.

embedding_rnn_decoder has a parameter num_symbols which is the same as num_decoder_symbols and hte documentation says "It is of shape [batch_size x num_decoder_symbols] when output_projection is None." so at the very least it seems that this documentation is in fact unclear. Would you prefer if I open up a separate issue for this?

Maybe we are reading different documentation, because it is claimed that embedding_rnn_decoder does this.
embedding_rnn_decoder has a parameter num_symbols which is the same as num_decoder_symbols and hte documentation says "It is of shape [batch_size x num_decoder_symbols] when output_projection is None." so at the very least it seems that this documentation is in fact unclear.  Would you prefer if I open up a separate issue for this?
body:
Maybe we are reading different documentation, because it is claimed that embedding_rnn_decoder does this.

embedding_rnn_decoder has a parameter [num_symbols](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/r1.3/tensorflow/contrib/legacy_seq2seq/python/ops/seq2seq.py#L236) which is the same as num_decoder_symbols and hte [documentation](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/r1.3/tensorflow/contrib/legacy_seq2seq/python/ops/seq2seq.py#L273) says "It is of shape [batch_size x num_decoder_symbols] when output_projection is None." so at the very least it seems that this documentation is in fact unclear.  Would you prefer if I open up a separate issue for this?
